forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain showers between 2am and 4am, then showers and thunderstorms. Mostly cloudy. Low around 66, with temperatures rising to around 68 overnight. South southwest wind 15 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Evanston, the afternoon unfolds under a cloak of partly sunny skies, with a gentle warmth characteristic of a late October day. The temperature hovers around 79 degrees as brisk south-southwest winds, gusting up to 40 mph, rustle through the trees, adding an invigorating edge to the atmosphere. However, the evening promises a shift, with rain showers expected to materialize after midnight, giving way to more formidable thunderstorms as the night deepens. The temperature will remain mild, dipping to about 66 but gradually rising to a comfortable 68. A significant 80% chance of precipitation suggests that umbrellas may soon become essential accessories. 

The beach scene presents a calm before the storm; the waves lapping gently at the shore under the hazy light. While the view may be pleasant with a serene expanse of Lake Michigan, one can sense the tension in the air as darker clouds gather on the horizon. For those venturing out, layering is wise. A light jacket over a t-shirt will accommodate the day’s warmth and the cool evening that lies ahead. It's a day to cozy up with a book at a nearby café or perhaps enjoy a leisurely stroll along the shoreline, taking advantage of the last remnants of pleasant weather before the rain rolls in. As the sun sets and the clouds begin their slow takeover, the quietude of the beach may serve as a contemplative end to the day, urging one to reflect before a night of thunderstorms begins.
